alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 05 at 9:28AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Baton Rouge, Livingston and West Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Addis, Brusly, Merrydale, Westminster, Inniswold, Gardere, Brownfields, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson and Baton Rouge Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Livingston; West Baton Rouge
